expression: the early bird catches the worm

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: the early bird catches the worm

step1.sentence: She always arrives at the office an hour before everyone else, believing that the early bird catches the worm.

step2.story: Marcus set his alarm for 5 AM every day to get to the farmers' market before the crowds. The early bird catches the worm, and sure enough, he always snagged the freshest produce and best deals. By the time his neighbors arrived, the most sought-after items were already in his basket.

step3.story: When the city announced a limited number of spots for its popular small business grant program, Elena knew she couldn't afford to wait. She remembered what her father always told her — the early bird catches the worm — and submitted her application the very morning registrations opened. While her competitors spent days deliberating, she had already refined her proposal and followed up with the selection committee. Weeks later, when the results were announced, Elena's name was at the top of the list. Her competitors were stunned, but Elena simply smiled; preparation and timing had made all the difference.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 아침 일찍 일어나는 새가 먹이(벌레)를 잡는다는 뜻으로, 일찍 행동하는 사람이 이익을 얻는다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 '먼저 움직이는 사람이 기회를 잡는다'는 뜻으로 쓰이며, 일찍 준비하거나 행동하는 것의 중요성을 강조할 때 사용합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 17세기 영국 작가 윌리엄 캠던의 저서 『Remaines of a Greater Worke』(1605)에 처음 등장한 표현으로, 자연 현상에서 비유를 가져온 오래된 격언입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 조언하는 어조로 쓰이며, 게으름을 경계하거나 부지런함을 격려할 때 자주 인용됩니다. 지나치게 경쟁적인 느낌 없이 자기계발의 맥락에서 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I booked my flight six months in advance — the early bird catches the worm.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 6개월 전에 미리 항공편을 예약했어요 — 일찍 움직이는 사람이 기회를 잡으니까요.
